channel.title: PC shuts off while playing games
channel.description:
so I've had this problem for over 2 months now, every time I play any intensified 3D game (COD:BO, WOW, Assassin's creed, etc...) my PC shuts off completely, I've ran some tests to see the Heat of my Video card while playing and it only reached about 55-70c, and still I have this problem :S, I've checked in every corner around the net and honestly I didn't find a solution, I've updated my drivers and I also checked the ram's and CPU heats and all turned out to be just fine, so do you guys have any Idea on how to fix this damn problem ?
p.s My Video card is ATI Radeon 5750 Series
[img]https://www.chip.co.id/direct/wp-content/uploads/2009/10/xfx_5700_series_large.jpg[/img]

item.title: PC shuts off while playing games
item.dc:creator: Shadi
item.description:
okey guys I’ll see what I can do

Read full topic
item.source: PC shuts off while playing games

item.title: PC shuts off while playing games
item.dc:creator: p0rt1r
item.description:
Unstable OC? I cant overclock my gpu at all (radeon 4890). If i do OC it, it crashes within seconds of starting a game.
Try putting your cpu back to its default clock speed and voltages.

Also try running furmark and see if it crashes. If it doesnt, try running a cpu benchmarking app like everest.

Also tell us your temps for everything under full load would be nice.

Read full topic
item.source: PC shuts off while playing games

item.title: PC shuts off while playing games
item.dc:creator: Jeannotvb
item.description:
The powersupply might not be able to deliver stable voltages. It’s never a good idea to be ‘on the edge’ anyway, you don’t want your powersupply to run at full power all the time.

Read full topic
item.source: PC shuts off while playing games

item.title: PC shuts off while playing games
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
Just my two cents, it really does seem like a PSU issue, and i don’t know of any brand name PSUs that have a peak output of 530, but I do know of cheap PSUs that have a max output of 530. It could be that your video card isn’t getting enough amperage on the 12v rails, also probably due to the PSU being a cheap brand.

Read full topic
item.source: PC shuts off while playing games

item.title: PC shuts off while playing games
item.dc:creator: calhoun_freeman
item.description:
Is your CPU temp under load under 70 degrees celcius?

Also try running some test in prime95. We might be able to isolate the GPU out of this.

Read full topic
item.source: PC shuts off while playing games

item.title: PC shuts off while playing games
item.dc:creator: lithium.bb
item.description:
He said he checked the temps, so that’s not the problem. Frankly I would really doubt that there’s an issue with your house’s wiring unless the breaker/GFI trips. Does the PSU have some brand name on it?

Read full topic
item.source: PC shuts off while playing games

item.title: PC shuts off while playing games
item.dc:creator: calhoun_freeman
item.description:
Duck:

I just had the same problem, it was my CPU fan slighty loose, easy to fix but annoying

If the CPU fan was loose, the cpu would have overheated like hell.

Read full topic

item.description:
I just had the same problem, it was my CPU fan slighty loose, easy to fix but annoying

item.source: PC shuts off while playing games

item.title: PC shuts off while playing games
item.dc:creator: lithium.bb
item.description:
dblkion:

BS.

–

My PSU is a corsair 650w.

lithium.bb:

If the power supply isn’t good quality to start with (as in some strange off-brand) you might only be able to get 530w max, not 530 sustained. And yeah, that is almost definitely a PSU issue.

YOU have a corsair. Corsairs are not cheap off-brands, like the OP probably has.

Read full topic
item.source: PC shuts off while playing games

item.title: PC shuts off while playing games
item.dc:creator: Smatj
item.description:
it can be overheating too tho… that’s what happened with my card a while back.

Read full topic
item.source: PC shuts off while playing games

item.title: PC shuts off while playing games
item.dc:creator: dblkion
item.description:
gman912:

^I agree. running a quad cpu, 4g of mem, 64-bit windows, and a graphics card, you want a little more juice running through your system. lucky for you, that’s about the cheapest part you can buy. at least aim for around 800 to play it safe, more if you’re running 2 cards.

BS.

My system :

i7-2600k
P8p67 deluxe
8Go ddr3r
2x 6950HD
2x 500go storage drive
1x 120go vertex 3 SSD

2 led fans, and 4 normal fans, leds on the case for fan speed control, leds on the motherboard for plugged in stuff status, G15 keyboard, G600 mouse, a heavy joystick with alot of leds … and I’m probably forgeting some.

My PSU is a corsair 650w.

Read full topic
item.source: PC shuts off while playing games

item.title: PC shuts off while playing games
item.dc:creator: Luciel
item.description:
Well, depending on where you live and if you can get the brand NOX there, they currently have the NOX Urano 650 and 750w models in discount as they are bringing a new model out next month, now I know this is happening all over Europe, no idea about the rest, have a look for it as it´s a rather good PSU that´s quite cheap, I´d say, as good as it gets in value/quality ration for an under 80+ seal psu.

Read full topic
